curated_text: Symbol: MDLZ. Year: 2022. Period: Q3. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: the European Economic Area, the European Commission, Third-Party Guarantees, Mondelēz International, Mondelēz International: Balance, the U.S. Treasury Department, EPS, AMEA, Basis of Presentation, Acquisitions and Divestitures, Plant and Equipment, Restructuring Program, Financial Instruments, AMEA Europe North America Total, Gum & Candy, Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition, Significant Items Affecting Comparability War, Items Affecting Comparability of Financial Results, Financial Outlook, Organic Net Revenue, Discussion and Analysis of Historical Results, Chipita S.A., Financial Measures, • Diluted EPS, • Adjusted EPS, Adjusted EPS, Non-GAAP Financial Measures, State of Snacking, COVID-19, Commodity Trends and Item 3, Ricolino, Grupo Bimbo, Congress, the U.S. House of Representatives, Senate, the Organization of Economic Cooperation and Development, OECD, the Consolidated Results of Operations, Basis of Presentation – War, Diluted, Chipita, Gourmet Food, Adjusted Operating Income, Gourmet Food Holdings Pty Ltd, Hu Master Holdings, Mondelēz International, KDP, Supply Chain Financing, SCF, Contingencies, Board of Directors, Mondelez International Holdings Netherlands B.V., Board, DIV, London Interbank Offered Rates, Omicron. Context excerpt: competition law through certain practices restricting cross-border trade within the European Economic Area. On January 28, 2021, the European Commission announced it has taken the next procedural step in its investigation and opened formal proceedings. We are cooperating with the investigation and expect to continue to engage with the European Commission as its investigation proceeds. It is not possible to predict how long the investigation will take or the ultimate outcome of this matter. Third-Party Guarantees: We enter into third-party guarantees primarily to cover long-term obligations of our vendors. As part of these transactions, we guarantee that third parties will make contractual payments or achieve performance measures. At March 31, 2022, we had no material third-party guarantees recorded on our condensed consolidated balance sheet. Tax Matters: We are a party to various tax matter proceedings incidental to our business. These proceedings are subject to inherent uncertainties

competition_summary.context: competition law through certain practices restricting cross-border trade within the European Economic Area. On January 28, 2021, the European Commission announced it has taken the next procedural step in its investigation and opened formal proceedings. We are cooperating with the investigation and expect to continue to engage with the European Commission as its investigation proceeds. It is not possible to predict how long the investigation will take or the ultimate outcome of this matter. Third
